tool.name: calcPoint_PTFs
tool.displayname: Calculate water content using point PTFs

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool should be stored.

param.name: Input_shapefile
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename of the input soil shapefile. Soil shapefile can be polygon or point vector which includes required soil properties of the selected PTFs.

param.name: PTF_of_choice
param.expression: Nguyen et al. (2014) | Adhikary et al. (2008) | Rawls et al. (1982) | Hall et al. (1977) topsoil | Hall et al. (1977) subsoil | Gupta and Larson (1979) | Batjes (1996) | Saxton and Rawls (2006) | Pidgeon (1972) | Lal (1978) Group I - Clay, BD | Lal (1978) Group II - Clay, BD | Aina and Periaswamy (1985) | Manrique and Jones (1991) | van Den Berg et al. (1997) | Tomasella and Hodnett (1998) | Reichert et al. (2009) - Sand, silt, clay, OM, BD | Reichert et al. (2009) - Sand, silt, clay, BD | Botula Manyala (2013) | Shwetha and Varija (2013) | Dashtaki et al. (2010) | Santra et al. (2018) - Sand, Clay, OC, BD | Santra et al. (2018) - Sand, Clay, BD
param.dialogReference: Select the PTFs of interest from the dropdown list.

param.name: FieldCapacity
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at field capacity
param.dialogReference: Specify pressure for field capacity from the dropdown list. There are three options, -10kPa, -20kPa or -33kPa for field capacity when using point-PTFs.

param.name: SIC
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at water stress-induced stomata closure
param.dialogReference: The default value is -100kPa. However, user can type in the pressure of interest to define water stress-induced stomata closure point. Please check whether the selected point-PTFs can give soil moisture at the pressure of interest. If the point-PTFs stomata closure point is not available, RAW is estimated as 0.5 of PAW.

param.name: PWP
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at permanent wilting point
param.dialogReference: The default value is -1500kPa. However, you can type in the pressure of interest to define permanent wilting point. Please check whether the selected point-PTFs can give soil moisture at the pressure of interest.

param.name: Carbon_content
param.displayname: Carbon: Does your dataset contain organic carbon or organic matter?
param.dialogReference: Specifying soil carbon information in the input data. If the selected PTFs require organic matter (OM) but the input data only has organic carbon (OC) or inversely, this function can be used to convert OM to OC and inversely.

param.name: Conversion_factor
param.dialogReference: LUCI_PTFs gives default conversion factors: 1.724 to convert OC to OM and 0.58 to convert OM to OC. However, user can customise the factor by typing in this parameter.

param.name: Pressure_units_plot
param.dialogReference: Selecting the pressure unit for plotting soil moisture result. LUCI_PTFs has thee pressure unit options: kPa, cm and m.

tool.summary:
This tool provides 21 options to estimate soil moisture content at certain pressure using point-PTFs. When a point-PTF is selected, the tool also estimates soil water held between key thresholds including drainable water, plant available water, readily available water, and total water content if the specified pressures are calculated by their chosen PTF.

To select the PTFs of interest, users can use the guidelines given in the paper “Guidelines and a supporting toolbox for parameterising key soil hydraulic properties in hydrological studies and broader integrated modelling” (Dang et al., 2021).
